title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: Support financial market development and efficient pricing of government securities through development of a short-term money market index. Support development of a Primary Dealer system to enhance primary market distribution and secondary market trading of government securities. Enhance government bond market through development of benchmark bonds.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Supports implementation of EAC-wide economic and financial market reforms and EAC convergence goals. Objective is to support the EAC Regional Financial Markets Development Plan and help each of the countries efforts to attain standards related to monetary and economic reform which have been earmarked as priority convergence criteria. The Regional Financial Markets Development Plans central focus is the harmonization of policy structures; standardizing fiscal, monetary and debt management frameworks; upgrading financial infrastructure, and building institutional capacity. A major EAC goal is increasing capital flows among the member countries. Assistance focuses on developing comprehensive debt management frameworks; identifying and removing barriers to securities market development; enhancing market activity so that local financial markets can serve as an efficient mechanism for the implementation of fiscal policy and monetary operations in host countries - all of which support economic growth and free capital flows.

Technical assistance is being provided to Ministries of Finance and Central Banks within the EAC regarding the strengthening, reform and/or design and implementation of:.. Payment system integration, with special emphasis on electronic cross-border payments. Deposit protection schemes in the context of an integrated financial and banking market . Macroeconomic and monetary policies. Financial stability; coordination of responses to threats to financial stability. Design and implementation of economic research programs in support of banking and financial market development . Anti-money Laundering and Financial Crimes. Public finance, financial management and policy . Small and medium-sized enterprise (SME) lending;. Financial inclusion..

description.narrative: To assist in the establishment of new Public Private Partnership Secretariats within Ministries of Finance and to help build the capacity of these new organizations to assist other agencies within national governments, as well as local governments, in developing successful Public Private Partnerships to finance much-needed infrastructure.

Technical assistance is being provided to Ministries of Finance and Central Banks within the EAC regarding the strengthening, reform and/or design and implementation of:.. Payment system integration, with special emphasis on electronic cross-border payments. Deposit protection schemes in the context of an integrated financial and banking market . Macroeconomic and monetary policies. Financial stability; coordination of responses to threats to financial stability. Design and implementation of economic research programs in support of banking and financial market development . Anti-money Laundering and Financial Crimes. Public finance, financial management and policy . Small and medium-sized enterprise (SME) lending;. Financial inclusion..

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - West Africa

description.narrative: ECT technical assistance will aim to improve measures to prevent illicit financing from penetrating financial and commercial sectors; enforcement measures to address situations when preventative measures fall short; and to assist in FIU development, given the critical role the FIU plays in maximizing performance of preventative stakeholders; collecting financial intelligence from preventative stakeholders, analyzing it and disseminating value-added work product to enforcement stakeholders to support case development and successful prosecutions and asset recoveries. Additionally ECT will assist in promoting regional approaches and collaboration...

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - Senegal / Guinea

description.narrative: The Senegalese DMO has graduated from f/t OTA assistance. This project is designed to improve the coordination of the DMO with the Tresors other key departments: the cash management and forecasting units. In Guinea, work will focus on the internal debt management unit, building its capacity to plan debt issuances and manage its portfolio, with a particular focus on re-financing risk posed by the limited number of debt instruments.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - Rwanda and Burundi

description.narrative: Develop basic market-related infrastructure and build capacity that lays a foundation for development of money and government securities markets. Assistance includes broad range of activities including reviewing the current debt stock, identifying the obstacles to primary market development and secondary market liquidity, building a capacity to undertake debt sustainability analysis, widening the investor base, and improving inter-agency communication. Support the development and implementation of East Africa Community mandated Financial Market Development Plan.
